blocks.text:
Business Centre Vacancies Home Market Place Tenders & Competitions Job Opportunities UNDP Projects Place About Business Centre Opening 
in UNDP Ukraine : 
Programme Manager on Environment

United Nations Development Programme Office in Ukraine 
is seeking proactive and energetic professional for the post of Programme Manager on Environment and Energy Efficiency to work 
in UNDP Ukraine Programme Section. Environment and Energy Efficiency is one of 6 
UNDP Practice Areas and is paid special attention to by our organization. 
Application from those qualified for the position with detailed CV in English 
should be submitted urgently with reference Programme Manager on Environment 
and Energy Efficiency. Deadline for applications is 20 June 
2002 . UNDP will use a transparent and competitive screening process, 
though will only contact those applicants in whom there is further interest. 
Before sending application please visit our web-site for detailed information on 
the vacancy and information on our organization: www.un.kiev.ua Fax: (044) 253-2607; e-mail: 
vegorov@un.kiev.ua

Terms of Reference for the 
post
1. Promotion of UNDP Practice Area

Act as a knowledge based advisory services provider 
 within the assigned UNDP practice area of Environment and Energy Efficiency at 
 the country level; Facilitate continuous dialogue with the Government and 
 other key partners to provide knowledge based advisory services and to ensure 
 proper integration and co-ordination of UNDP programmes with other related 
 development efforts; Participate in designing project/programme documents and 
 contribute to the UNDP pipe-line portfolio, generate and discuss new project 
 ideas; Participate in the approval of the new projects, 
 submission of the project concepts and documents to the LPACs for reviews; Increase the impact of the UNDP programme by expanding 
 the outcomes and delivering the results; Organize workshops and consultations on practice area 
 with governmental and non-governmental institutions and organizations, 
 academia and think tanks, local leaders and governors; Organize cluster meetings with UNDP 
 Teams to strategize on delivering of results within the practice area 
 assigned;

2. Application of Millennium Development Goals 
in practice

Set the MDG monitoring principles within the assigned 
 practice area; Advocate, promote awareness and understanding of issues 
 and responses related to the all important goals which Ukraine has committed 
 to at the Millennium Summit and other global conferences; Contribute to the development of the 
 UNDP strategic reports and analytical documents incorporating 
 MDGs;
3. UNDP Support to the UN

Provide assistance with the design and implementation of 
 the joint UN Country Team programmes, initiatives and activities; Contribute to the promoting of the 
 joint UN response to the issues of the UN Family concern as stated in the CCA 
 and UNDAF.

4. Partnerships and Resource 
Mobilization

Mobilize cost-sharing resources from the Government, 
 donors and other partners to leverage UNDP resources; Facilitate implementation of joint formulation missions 
 with potential donors to develop the sound partnership for the project 
 designing stage; Maintain partnerships with EU, World Bank and private 
 sector to ensure wide participation in development issues that UNDP is 
 addressing; Organize donor visits to the project sites; Assure that the UNDP country office is linked to highest 
 officials in the government, private sector, donor institutions, local 
 authorities, mayors, municipalities and other stakeholders; Participate in the round tables, 
 conferences and workshops organized by the partner organizations to promote 
 UNDP vision, values and approaches;
5. Managing for Results

Introduce and implement SRF oriented annual and quarter 
 work-planning and progress reporting system to simplify project operations; Contribute to preparation of the ROAR and other RBMS 
 tools on the programme portfolio assigned; Implement the office annual work-plans with specific 
 targets; Introduce and implement performance and impact assessment 
 indicators and database system in the projects and CO; Participate in the process of preparation of the result 
 oriented documents to disseminate achievements of each programme within 
 assigned programme portfolio; In a partnership with national project managers, oversee 
 strategic planning and coordination of project activities to ensure that 
 objectives are reached; extrapolate lessons learned from programme activities 
 and ensure horizontal exchange of knowledge; Proactively disseminate lessons learned to media in 
 partnership with the UNDP Communications Team; Organize quarterly reviews and annual review of the 
 impact of the projects/programs, participates in the project evaluations, as 
 well as in assessment missions; Participate 
 in regular programme managers forums organized on a monthly basis, assuring 
 that one-page reporting on key progress/issues is prepared on the assigned 
 UNDP practice area; Monitor ongoing 
 projects substantively; provide assessment and analysis on the achievement of 
 objectives and results; guide and orients the efforts and 
 contributions of consultants, project personnel, other donors and Government 
 institutions towards the achievement of project objectives, monitor delivery 
 of the project resources to meet the work-plans;
6. Knowledge Management and Sharing

Participate in country level networks within the UNDP 
 practice area assigned; Participate and contribute to the global knowledge 
 networks of UNDP in the practice area assigned; Monitors/analyzes economic, social and political issues 
 which affect sectoral or national development; through this process, identify 
 development needs and potential solutions relevant to UNDPs technical 
 co-operation activities; compile and document assessments in key policy areas; Contribute to knowledge retreats with governors, 
 mayors, think tanks, and other friends of UNDP; Participate in consultative meetings with government 
 and donors in the practice area; Contribute to national development documents in the 
 thematic/sectoral areas assigned; propose content of Strategic Results 
 Framework (SRF) and Results Oriented Annual Report (ROAR)s in the sectoral and 
 thematic areas managed; Promote coordination and integration of UNDP national 
 projects with respective regional and global programmes and projects, 
 including those based at the RBEC Regional Support Center in Bratislava 
 (Slovakia) as well as UNDP RBEC SURF; Optimize the 
 utilization of RBEC and BDP policy experts in HQs and SRC in 
 Bratislava;
7. Advocacy and Communications

Promote clarity and understanding on the role and issues 
 of UNDP; Participate in development of comprehensive programme 
 oriented UNDP web site; Participate in development of UNDP projects and 
 programmes communication materials, papers, and other publications; Facilitate transformation of the UNDP and project staff 
 into development communicators and government and other partners unto UNDP 
 advocates and facilitators; Disseminate successful experience in the practice area 
 globally through the SURF system and UNDP global web-site; Engage project staff in dissemination of the successful 
 initiatives and services of UNDP; Assure development of the project web-sites as the 
 specialized knowledge channels and link these to the main UNDP web-site; Represent UNDP 
 accordingly at public events within the assigned practice 
 area;
8. Other

Perform a variety of functions related 
 to the programme section mandate; Minimum qualifications for the 
post

1.  
Mature 
judgment in the area of Environment and Energy Efficiency combined with a 
proactive, energetic approach to problem solving; excellent 
interpersonal and communication skills; strong organizational and time 
management skills; resourceful in finding solutions; 2.  
Strong ideals to 
support national development in Ukraine and serve as a catalyst for human 
development, poverty 
reduction with focus at 
environment and energy efficiency; 3.  
At least 5 
years of practical managerial and/or business development experience in the area 
of environment and energy efficiency with practical applications in project 
area, including experience in policy formulation (references 
required); 4.  
Ability to 
work with a wide cross-section of partners: Government, NGOs, communities, 
media and international donors; 5.  
Knowledge of 
Ukrainian legislative, policy and human resource issues as they apply to the 
development area of environment and energy efficiency; 6.  
Desire to make 
a positive change in Ukraine; 7.  
Upwards of a 
Masters degree in a relevant to the position field (environment, ecology, 
etc.); 8.  
Knowledge of 
the management principles and organizational behavior; 9.  
Fluent 
Ukrainian, Russian, English; 10. 
Excellent 
communication and writing skills in all three languages (English, 
Ukrainian, Russian,) is a must; 11. 
Ability to 
think clearly and precisely articulate are essential; 12. Knowledge of 
and complete comfort with 
computer 
applications is essential 
(including organization of public presentations on 
PowerPoint). 13. Good contacts within the development 
area of environment, including contacts with donor organizations, NGOs, 
governmental institutions. Applications in English language with the 
reference to this position are to be submitted: to e-mail address : vegorov@un.kiev.ua , or fax (044) 
253-26-07. Please, indicate the Position you are applying 
for in the Subject line of your message. UNDP will use a transparent and competitive 
screening process, though will only contact those applicants in whom there is 
further interest. Qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply.
